question: With reference to Bonobos, consider the following statements:
statements: They are found only in the forests of Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).
Bonobos are known for male-dominant social structures.
They share over 98% of their DNA with humans.
explanation: Bonobos are one of the closest relatives of humans, sharing approximately **98.7%** of DNA. They are distinct from chimpanzees in their **peaceful, female-led** social structures and are found only in **DRC forests**. Learn more: [Wikipedia – Bonobo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonobo)

question: Which state recently became the first to formally implement Scheduled Caste (SC) sub-categorisation?
explanation: Telangana is the first state to implement **SC sub-categorisation**, following a 7-judge bench verdict in *State of Punjab vs Davinder Singh (2024)* which allowed sub-classification within SCs. It enables targeted affirmative action. [Read more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scheduled_Castes_and_Scheduled_Tribes)

question: Consider the following about the Gandhi Sagar Wildlife Sanctuary:
statements: It lies in the state of Rajasthan.
River Narmada flows through this sanctuary.
It is part of Khathiar-Gir dry deciduous forest type.
explanation: Gandhi Sagar Wildlife Sanctuary is in **Madhya Pradesh**, located in **Mandsaur and Nimach** districts. **River Chambal**, not Narmada, passes through it. It lies in the **Khathiar-Gir dry deciduous forest** zone. Source: [Gandhi Sagar WS - MP Tourism](https://www.mptourism.com/destination-gandhi-sagar-wildlife-sanctuary.html)

question: Which of the following diseases has prompted WHO to release its first-ever global guidelines on diagnosis and treatment?
explanation: WHO released its first-ever guidelines on **meningitis**, a serious inflammation of the brain and spinal cord membranes. The guidelines are part of the **Defeating Meningitis by 2030** initiative. [WHO Roadmap](https://www.who.int/initiatives/defeating-meningitis-by-2030)

question: Consider the following statements about the Indian Plate Movement:
statements: The Indian Plate is bordered by the Eurasian, Arabian, African, and Australian plates.
Delamination is a new theory suggesting that the Indian Plate is splitting apart.
Underplating refers to subduction of the Indian Ocean Plate beneath the Eurasian Plate.
explanation: **Delamination** is a geological process where the lower crust detaches and sinks into the mantle. It is now suggested in explaining Indian Plate tectonics. The Indian Plate indeed borders the **four major plates**, but underplating is **not subduction of the oceanic plate**. [Tectonic Plates – Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tectonic_plate)

question: Q-Shield, the recently launched cybersecurity platform, is developed by:
explanation: **QNu Labs**, an Indian quantum cybersecurity startup, launched **Q-Shield**, the world’s first integrated cryptography management platform supporting **hybrid, cloud, and on-premise** systems. [QNu Labs Official](https://www.qnulabs.com/)

question: The Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) was established under which legislation?
explanation: **BEE** is a statutory body under the **Energy Conservation Act, 2001** under the Ministry of Power. It sets **minimum energy performance standards** and enforces the **Standards & Labelling Programme**. [Wikipedia – BEE](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bureau_of_Energy_Efficiency)

question: Consider the following about District Mineral Foundation (DMF):
statements: DMFs are established under the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957.
Mining lease holders contribute a percentage of royalty to DMF.
More than 70% of DMF funds must be used for infrastructure projects only.
explanation: **DMFs** are set up under the **MMDR Act, 1957** for the welfare of people affected by mining. Although they have large funds, **over 70% of it should go to welfare, not infrastructure**. [Ministry of Mines – DMF](https://mines.gov.in/DMF)

question: The ESA Biomass mission will primarily help monitor:
explanation: ESA’s **Biomass mission** is launching a **P-band SAR satellite** to penetrate forest canopies and accurately measure **forest biomass and carbon storage**, crucial for tracking climate change. [ESA Biomass Mission](https://www.esa.int/Applications/Observing_the_Earth/Biomass)

question: BatEchoMon, recently in news, is:
options: A space mission to detect dark matter
A type of sonar used in submarines
A robotic system for wildlife patrolling
explanation: **BatEchoMon** is India’s first automated system developed by **IIHS Bengaluru** that uses AI and Raspberry Pi to monitor and classify **bat echolocation calls** in real time. [Read on IIHS Website](https://iihs.co.in/)

question: With reference to Chettur Sankaran Nair, consider the following statements:
statements: He served as a permanent judge of the Madras High Court.
He was appointed to the Viceroy’s Executive Council.
He presided over the Lahore Session of Indian National Congress in 1905.
explanation: Chettur Sankaran Nair was the **youngest president of INC in 1897 (Amraoti session)**, not 1905. He was indeed a **Madras HC judge** and a member of the **Viceroy’s Executive Council**. [Wikipedia – Chettur Sankaran Nair](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chettur_Sankaran_Nair)

question: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar advocated the following means to achieve an ideal society:
statements: Abolition of caste through constitutional reforms
Adoption of state socialism and nationalisation
Use of violence as a tool for social revolution
explanation: Ambedkar strongly advocated **constitutional means** for restructuring society. He supported **state socialism** and **abolition of caste**, but not **violence**. Source: [Ambedkar on Annihilation of Caste](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annihilation_of_Caste)

question: Which of the following is true regarding the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC)?
options: It is a private consortium of logistics and retail firms
It is developed by NITI Aayog for e-governance
It is under DPIIT and promotes open-source digital commerce
It is a regulatory body under TRAI
correct_option: It is under DPIIT and promotes open-source digital commerce
explanation: **ONDC** is a government initiative under **DPIIT** (Ministry of Commerce & Industry) aiming to democratize digital commerce via **open protocols and open-source platforms**. [ONDC Official Website](https://ondc.org/)

question: Consider the following recommendations from ICAR-NIAP’s ‘Indian Agriculture to 2047’ report:
statements: Promote micro-irrigation and groundwater recharge.
Phase out electricity subsidies in agriculture.
Reduce the role of animal husbandry in agricultural GVA.
explanation: The ICAR-NIAP report recommends **efficient water use** and **phasing out unsustainable subsidies**, but supports **increased diversification**, including animal husbandry. [NIAP Report Summary](https://www.ncap.res.in/)

question: Which of the following terms are associated with tectonic plate processes?
statements: Delamination
Subduction
Underplating
explanation: **Delamination** (peeling of dense crust), **subduction** (sliding beneath), and **underplating** (accumulation beneath crust) are all geological processes explaining Himalayan orogeny and Indian Plate behavior. [Plate Tectonics – Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plate_tectonics)

question: Which of the following sectors are classified as ‘Critical Infrastructure’ in the context of cybersecurity?
statements: Energy
Telecom
Entertainment
explanation: **Critical Infrastructure** includes sectors like **Energy, Telecom, Financial services, and Public Health**, due to their impact on national security and economic stability. Entertainment is not classified as critical. [Wikipedia – Critical infrastructure](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Critical_infrastructure)

question: Global Financial Stability Report is released by:
explanation: The **IMF** publishes the **Global Financial Stability Report (GFSR)** biannually to assess systemic risks, vulnerabilities, and policy recommendations for financial markets. [GFSR - IMF](https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/GFSR)

question: Which of the following are identified in the IMF report as risks arising from geopolitics?
statements: Supply chain disruptions
Declining investor confidence
Reduction in sovereign debt
explanation: The **IMF report** highlights **supply chain risks**, **investor sentiment drop**, and **fiscal stress** (not reduction) as major challenges during geopolitical uncertainty. [IMF GFSR](https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/GFSR)

question: Which of the following best describes the concept of 'compositionality' observed in Bonobo communication?
options: Use of mimicry to build sentences
Ability to form complex meanings by combining vocal units
correct_option: Ability to form complex meanings by combining vocal units
explanation: **Compositionality** is a trait of **human language**, where meanings are derived from combining units. Bonobos show a similar pattern in vocal communication, hinting at early language evolution. [Bonobo Study – Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonobo#Communication)

question: Which of the following statements best reflects Dr. Ambedkar’s principle of fraternity?
options: The rule of the majority is absolute.
Individual rights must override social cohesion.
Society should function as a homogenous cultural unit.
Individuals from different backgrounds should associate freely and work together.
correct_option: Individuals from different backgrounds should associate freely and work together.
explanation: **Fraternity**, for Dr. Ambedkar, was the **glue of democracy**, ensuring people from various communities live in **dignity, equality, and mutual respect**. It complements liberty and equality. [Ambedkar and Fraternity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B._R._Ambedkar#Philosophy)

question: Which of the following best defines 'Delamination' in plate tectonics?
options: Subduction of an oceanic plate under continental plate
Sliding of tectonic plates over magma
Peeling and sinking of a plate’s lower layer into the mantle
correct_option: Peeling and sinking of a plate’s lower layer into the mantle
explanation: **Delamination** refers to the process where the **dense lower section** of a tectonic plate **detaches and sinks** into the Earth's hot mantle. It differs from traditional subduction and is recently hypothesized in the Indian Plate’s tectonics. [Wikipedia – Delamination (geology)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delamination_(geology))

question: Which of the following river passes through the Gandhi Sagar Wildlife Sanctuary?
explanation: **River Chambal** flows through the **Gandhi Sagar Wildlife Sanctuary** in Madhya Pradesh. The sanctuary also surrounds the **Gandhi Sagar Dam** backwaters. It lies in the Khathiar-Gir dry deciduous forest region. [MPTourism](https://www.mptourism.com/destination-gandhi-sagar-wildlife-sanctuary.html)

question: Consider the following statements about meningitis:
statements: It is caused only by bacteria and not by viruses.
It leads to inflammation of membranes surrounding brain and spinal cord.
WHO launched its first-ever guidelines for it under 'Defeating Meningitis by 2030' roadmap.
explanation: Meningitis is an **inflammation of membranes** (meninges) around the brain and spinal cord. It can be caused by **bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites**. WHO released its first global guidelines under **‘Defeating Meningitis by 2030’** roadmap. [WHO – Meningitis](https://www.who.int/initiatives/defeating-meningitis-by-2030)

question: BatEchoMon, an AI-based system, has been developed by:
explanation: **BatEchoMon** is India’s first autonomous bat monitoring system developed by **IIHS Bengaluru**. It uses **Raspberry Pi** and **AI algorithms** to identify bat calls in real-time for ecological research. [IIHS India](https://iihs.co.in/)

question: Which of the following explains the term 'compositionality' in animal communication?
options: Combining basic vocal units to create complex meanings
Use of repetitive signals to indicate threat
Communication based only on body language
correct_option: Combining basic vocal units to create complex meanings
explanation: **Compositionality** refers to the ability to create complex messages by combining smaller meaningful units. Bonobos show signs of such communication, similar to human linguistic traits. [Wikipedia – Compositionality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compositionality)

question: Which of the following statements about Scheduled Caste (SC) sub-categorisation is/are correct?
statements: It involves deletion or addition of castes to the Presidential list under Article 341.
The Supreme Court has ruled that sub-classification is permissible under Article 14.
Telangana is the first Indian state to implement it.
explanation: The **Supreme Court** in 2024 upheld SC sub-classification as a means of **substantive equality (Article 14)**. It does **not affect Presidential List** under Article 341. Telangana became the **first** state to implement it. [Sub-classification in SCs – Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scheduled_Castes)

question: The District Mineral Foundation (DMF) funds must be primarily used for:
options: High priority welfare areas in mining regions
correct_option: High priority welfare areas in mining regions
explanation: **70% of DMF funds** must go to **drinking water, education, health, pollution control**, etc. Misuse for infrastructure is discouraged. Set up under **MMDR Act 1957**. [DMF – Ministry of Mines](https://mines.gov.in/DMF)

question: Which satellite mission is the first to use P-band Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR)?
explanation: **ESA's Biomass mission** uses **P-band SAR**, enabling it to measure forest carbon by penetrating canopies. It's part of climate monitoring efforts. [ESA Biomass Mission](https://www.esa.int/Applications/Observing_the_Earth/Biomass)

question: The Q-Shield platform launched by QNu Labs is designed to secure:
explanation: **Q-Shield** is a cryptography management platform by **QNu Labs** for securing **cloud, on-premise, and hybrid infrastructures**. It enhances cybersecurity for critical systems. [QNu Labs](https://www.qnulabs.com/)

question: Which of the following sectors are considered Critical Infrastructure?
statements: Energy
Finance
Media and Entertainment
explanation: **Critical infrastructure** includes sectors like **energy, telecom, financial services, water, and healthcare**, whose disruption affects national security. Media and entertainment are not included. [Critical Infrastructure – Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Critical_infrastructure)
